sentences: Ära tee nii! - Don't do that!
Ma ütlesin sulle ära juba eile. - I told you no yesterday.
Palun ära muretse. - Please don't worry.
context: The word 'ära' is a versatile negative particle in Estonian, used to express negation or prohibition. It’s often translated as ‘no’, ‘don’t’, or ‘not’ depending on the context. It can be used with verbs to form negative commands ('Ära tee!' - Don't do!) or to negate statements.
